intro: Paratropia divaricata, commonly known as the variable leaf paratropia, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that vary in shape and size. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, with five petals and stamens. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical environments.
